metadata.description: Poem of Charles Baudelaire, the stranger.
metadata.imageLegend: the marvelous passing clouds … up there!

articleBody:
2016Sep. 9th.

l'étranger

A stranger is ordinarily a person that is coming from another country.

In the question-answers that follows, all is taking place as if the one that is answering is not the stranger of anybody else.

To enjoy with moderation!

Text of the stranger

  1. - Who do you love the best, enigmatic man, say? your father, your mother, your sister or your brother?
  2. - I have neither father, nor mother, nor sister, nor brother.
  3. - Your friends?
  4. - You are using here a word whose meaning remains unknown to me to this day.
  5. - Your homeland?
  6. - I do not know in which latitude it lies.
  7. - Beauty?
  8. - I would love her willingly, goddess and immortal.
  9. - Gold?
  10. - I hate it as you hate God.
  11. - Eh! what do you love then, extraordinary stranger?
  12. - I love the clouds… the passing clouds … up there … up there … the marvelous clouds!

Charles Baudelaire, the stranger.

original text in french language.

English translation: original translation. Can be reproduced with mention « original translation to english by François Vidit », link included.
